meanings.definition: The tendency to form exclusive groups or cliques.
meanings.sent1: In high school, the cliquishness of the popular kids made it hard for others to join their group.
meanings.sent2: The cliquishness of the club members made it challenging for new people to feel welcome.
meanings.sent3: The cliquishness of the office team was like having a secret club with strict membership rules.
meanings.sent4: The cliquishness of the neighborhood moms was like an invisible barrier that kept others out.
meanings.sent5: The cliquishness of the students was so strong that it felt like being on the outside of a locked door.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being cliquey.
meanings.sent1: Her cliquishness was evident in how she only socialized with a small group of friends.
meanings.sent2: The cliquishness of the team led to exclusion of those who didn't fit in.
meanings.sent3: The cliquishness of the book club made it seem like a private party with a strict guest list.
meanings.sent4: The cliquishness of the coworkers created an atmosphere of favoritism and exclusion.
meanings.sent5: The cliquishness of the group was like a shield protecting them from outsiders.
